title: Sensitive Being Exhibition
description: Co-curating a cross-media group exhibition exploring "emotional experience" featuring 10 artists from four countries (Australia, China, Argentina, and the U.S.). The exhibition emphasizes the interaction between sensory perception and emotions, incorporating installations, video art, paintings, and other media.

title: Creative Collective Workshop Series
description: Initiated and leading a recurring series of community workshops based on "curation as a way of life." Inviting local Chinese and international students to explore creative potential in home spaces. Topics include home gallery experiments, improvisational creation, and language healing.
highlights: Built a community of 200+ diverse cultural exchange members
Topics: Home gallery curation, collaborative art-making, art therapy

title: Night at Museum - Visitor Studies Research
description: Conducting field research through structured observation and interviews at Melbourne Museum to analyze the impact of night exhibition activities on visitor behavior and experience. Research focuses on space usage and visitor behavior, creating interaction data-based visitor behavior maps.
highlights: Found night visitors prefer interactive installations and social activities
Provided optimization suggestions for exhibition planning and display design
